The fire effects were supervised by [[Chris Corbould]], and post-production MPC had to enhance the sequence by making the smoke look closer to the actors, so it would look more dangerous. A full-scale replica of the building's exterior was used for the exploding part Bond and Camille escape from. The boat chase was another scene that required very little CGI. Machine FX worked on replacing a few shots of visible stuntmen with a digital version of Craig's head, and recreated the boats Bond jumps over on his motorcycle to make it look more dangerous. Crowd creation was done for the ''[[Tosca]]'' scene by Machine FX, to make the performance look like it had sold out.{{cite news|title=Back into Bondage|date=16 November 2008|author=Bill Dawes|publisher=[[fxguide]]|url=http://www.fxguide.com/featured/back_into_bondage/|accessdate=22 November 2008}} Forster edited the opera scene to resemble ''[[The Man Who Knew Too Much (1956 film)|The Man Who Knew Too Much]]''. In total, there are 900+ visual effects shots in ''Quantum of Solace''. ===Music=== {{Main|Quantum of Solace (soundtrack)}} [[David Arnold]], who composed the scores for the previous four Bond films, returned for ''Quantum of Solace''. He said that Forster likes to work very closely with his composers and that, in comparison to the accelerated schedule he was tied to on ''Casino Royale'', the intention was to spend a long time scoring the film to "really work it out." He also said he would be "taking a different approach" with the score.{{cite video | people=Tommy Pearson, [[David Arnold]] | date=November 2007 | title=Interview with David Arnold | url=http://www.stageandscreenonline.com/_Media/DavidArnoldPart3.mp3 | format=mp3 | medium=Audio interview | publisher=Stage and Screen Online | accessdate=25 April 2008 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080911055431/http://www.stageandscreenonline.com/_Media/DavidArnoldPart3.mp3 | archivedate=11 September 2008 | df=dmy-all }} Arnold composed the music based on impressions from reading the script, and Forster edited those into the film.{{cite news|author=Mark Beaumont|title=The Midas touch of David Arnold and his influence on Bond|work=[[The Times]]|date=18 October 2008|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article4948366.ece|accessdate=18 October 2008 | location=London}} As with ''Casino Royale'', Arnold kept use of the "[[James Bond Theme]]" to a minimum. Arnold collaborated with [[Kieran Hebden]] for "Crawl, End Crawl," a remix of the score played during the end credits.{{cite news|title='Crawl, End Crawl' track from 'Quantum of Solace' now on iTunes|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]]|date=9 December 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/news/index.php?itemid=7146&t=mi6&s=news|accessdate=9 December 2008}} [[Jack White (musician)|Jack White]] of [[The White Stripes]] and [[Alicia Keys]] collaborated on "[[Another Way to Die]]," the first Bond music duet.{{cite news | title = Alicia Keys, Jack White Team For Bond Theme |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] | date = 29 July 2008 | url = http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1044639/alicia-keys-jack-white-team-for-bond-theme | accessdate=29 July 2008}}{{cite news | title = Quantum of Solace – News – Alicia Keys, Jack White Team For "Quantum of Solace" Theme Song (Press Release) | publisher = [[Columbia Pictures]] | date = 29 July 2008 | url = http://www.007.com/download/ThemeSong_QOS_PressRelease.pdf | accessdate=2 August 2008|format=PDF|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090327100324/http://www.007.com/download/ThemeSong_QOS_PressRelease.pdf|archivedate=27 March 2009}} They had wanted to work together for two years beforehand. The song was recorded in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]; White played the drums while Keys performed on the piano.{{cite news|author=Brian Hiatt|title=Jack White and Alicia Keys: Bond's New Duo|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=2 October 2008|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/23064110/jack_white_and_alicia_keys_bonds_new_duo|accessdate=16 September 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090215192816/http://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/23064110/jack_white_and_alicia_keys_bonds_new_duo|archivedate=15 February 2009}} [[The Memphis Horns]] also contributed to the track.{{cite news|title=Jack White Talks Bond|publisher=[[IGN]]|date=21 August 2008|url=http://uk.music.ign.com/articles/901/901612p1.html|accessdate=21 August 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081005114947/http://uk.music.ign.com/articles/901/901612p1.html|archivedate=5 October 2008|df=dmy-all}} White's favourite Bond theme is [[John Barry (composer)|John Barry]]'s instrumental piece for ''[[On Her Majesty's Secret Service (soundtrack)|On Her Majesty's Secret Service]]'', and he watched various opening credit sequences from the series for inspiration while mixing the track. [[Mark Ronson]] and [[Amy Winehouse]] had recorded a [[demo (music)|demo]] track for the film,{{cite news | title = Winehouse working on 'Bond theme' |publisher=[[BBC News Online]] | date = 28 April 2008 | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7371949.stm | accessdate=28 April 2008}} but Ronson explained Winehouse's well-publicised legal issues in the preceding weeks made her "not ready to record any music" at that time.{{cite news | title = Troubled Winehouse 'not ready' for Bond theme | publisher = [[CNN]]/[[Associated Press|AP]] | date =3 May 2008 | accessdate=3 May 2008 | url = http://www.cnn.com/2008/SHOWBIZ/Music/05/03/winehouse.bond.ap/index.html |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080506020030/http://www.cnn.com/2008/SHOWBIZ/Music/05/03/winehouse.bond.ap/index.html |archivedate = 6 May 2008}} ==Release== The film premiered at the [[Odeon Leicester Square]] on 29 October 2008. Princes [[Prince William, Duke of Cambridge|William]] and [[Prince Harry|Harry]] attended, and proceeds from the screening were donated to the charities [[Help for Heroes]] and [[the Royal British Legion]].{{cite news|title="Quantum of Solace" World Premiere Announced|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]]|date=5 August 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/sections/articles/bond_22_premiere_announced.php3?t=qos&s=qos&id=01974|accessdate=6 August 2008}} The film was originally scheduled to be released in the UK and North America on 7 November; however, Eon pushed forward the British date to 31 October during filming,{{cite news | author = Olly Richards | title = Quantum of Solace Gets Earlier Release | work = [[Empire (magazine)|Empire]] | date = 19 March 2008 | url = http://www.empireonline.com/news/story.asp?NID=22223 | accessdate=19 March 2008}} while the American date was pushed back in August to 14 November, after ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince]]'' had been moved to 2009, thereby allowing the distributors to market the film over the autumn blockbuster [[Thanksgiving]] holiday weekend.{{cite news|author=Columbia Pictures|title=Quantum of Solace Moved Back a Week|publisher=ComingSoon.net|date=21 August 2008|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=48142|accessdate=21 August 2008}} In Australia, the film was moved a week to 19 November, after [[20th Century Fox]] chose to release ''[[Australia (2008 film)|Australia]]'' on ''Quantum of Solace''{{'}}s original date of 26 November.{{cite news|author=Garry Maddox|title=Bond blinks first in battle of blockbusters|work=[[Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=6 September 2008|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/film/bond-blinks-first-in-battle-of-the-blockbusters/2008/09/05/1220121520755.html|accessdate=6 September 2008}} ===Marketing=== Returning [[product placement]] partners from ''Casino Royale'' included [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]], [[Heineken]], [[Smirnoff]], [[Omega SA]], [[Virgin Atlantic]] and [[Sony Mobile Communications|Sony Ericsson]].{{cite news|author=Marc Graser|title=Brands line up for Bond sequel|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=14 August 2008|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117990584.html |accessdate=15 August 2008}} A reported £50 million was earned in product placement, which tops the Bond films' record of £44 million for ''Die Another Day''.{{cite web|author=Steve McGinty|url=http://thescotsman.scotsman.com/features/Does-this-mean-Bond39s-past.4630875.jp|title=Does this mean Bond's past his sell-by date?|work=[[The Scotsman]]|date=27 October 2008|accessdate=15 November 2008}} The 2009 [[Ford Ka]] is driven by Camille in the film."[http://www.mi6-hq.com/news/index.php?itemid=6802&catid=106&t=mi6&s=news Bond girl Olga Kurylenko introduces Ford Ka at Paris Motor Show (video)]," [[MI6-HQ.com]] (10 March 2008). Retrieved 8 November 2008. [[Avon Products|Avon]] created a fragrance called Bond Girl 007 with [[Gemma Arterton]] as the "face" of the product.{{cite news|title=Avon to introduce Bond Girl 007 fragrance with Gemma Arterton|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]]|date=23 May 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/news/index.php?itemid=6273|accessdate=12 August 2008}} [[Coca-Cola]] became a promotional partner, rebranding [[Coke Zero]] as "Coke Zero Zero 7." A tie-in advert featured the orchestral element of "Another Way to Die."{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/video/2008/sep/11/advertising.jamesbond|title=Coca-Cola launches ad featuring Jack White's Quantum of Solace music|work=[[The Guardian]]|author=Mark Sweney|date=11 September 2008|accessdate=18 September 2008 | location=London}} In the film, Coca-Cola was briefly seen being served at Dominic Greene's party. Sony held a competition, "Mission for a Million," enabling registered players to use their products to complete certain tasks. Each completed "mission" gave consumers a chance to win $1 million and a trip to a top-secret location.{{cite web|title=Mission for a Million|publisher=[[Sony]]|url=http://www.sonymissionmillion.com/|accessdate=4 October 2008}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ====Merchandise==== [[Corgi International Limited]] made 5-inch action figures and gadgets (such as a voice-activated briefcase), as well as its traditional [[die-cast toy]] vehicles.{{cite news |title=New 007 Toys & Gadgets 2008 |publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]] |date=13 February 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/sections/articles/collecting_corgi_2008_toyfair3.php3 |accessdate=27 February 2008}}{{cite news |title=New Corgi Cars 2008 |publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]] |date=3 February 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/sections/articles/collecting_corgi_2008_toyfair2.php3 |accessdate=27 February 2008}} It also created 7-inch figures of characters from the previous films.{{cite news |title=New Corgi Action Figures|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]] |date=24 February 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/sections/articles/collecting_corgi_2008_toyfair1.php3 |accessdate=27 February 2008}} [[Scalextric]] released four racing sets to coincide with the film.{{cite news |title=Scalextric 007 Racing Sets Unveiled |publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]] |date=24 February 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/sections/articles/collecting_scalextric_2008_toyfair.php3?t=&s= |accessdate=27 February 2008}} [[Activision]] released its first James Bond game, also titled ''[[Quantum of Solace (video game)|Quantum of Solace]]'', which is based on both ''Casino Royale'' and ''Quantum of Solace''. It is the first [[James Bond (games)|Bond game]] to feature Craig's likeness and the first [[History of video game consoles (seventh generation)|seventh-generation console]] game in the series. [[Swatch]] designed a series of wrist watches, each of them inspired by a Bond villain.{{cite web|title=Swatch Launch 007 Villains Watches|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]]|date=9 September 2008|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/sections/articles/collecting_swatch_2008_launch.php3?t=&s=&id=02007|accessdate=14 November 2008}} Though the screenplay did not get made into a novel despite its original storyline, [[Penguin Books]] published a compilation of Fleming's short stories entitled ''[[For Your Eyes Only (short story collection)#Quantum of Solace|Quantum of Solace: The Complete James Bond Short Stories]]'', with a UK release date of 29 May 2008[https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/0141189622 Amazon.co.uk listing]. Retrieved 28 June 2008. and a North American release date of 26 August 2008.[https://www.amazon.com/dp/0143114581 Amazon.com listing]. Retrieved 24 May 2008 The book combines the contents of Fleming's two short story collections, ''[[For Your Eyes Only (short story collection)|For Your Eyes Only]]''—including the original "Quantum of Solace" short story—and ''[[Octopussy and The Living Daylights]]''. ===Home media=== ''Quantum of Solace'' was released on DVD and [[Blu-ray]] by [[MGM]] via [[20th Century Fox Home Entertainment]] in Australia, the UK and North America from 18 to 24 March 2009. On the DVD sales chart the film opened at No. 3, grossing $21,894,957 from 1.21m DVD units sold.{{cite web|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movies/2008/JB22-DVD.php |title=Quantum of Solace – DVD Sales |publisher=The Numbers |accessdate=1 November 2009}} {{As of|2009|November|1}}, 2,643,250 DVD units were sold, generating $44,110,750 in sales revenue. These figures do not include Blu-ray sales or DVD rentals. The DVDs were released in both a standard one-disc set and a deluxe two-disc special edition. There are no audio commentaries or deleted scenes on these editions.{{cite web|title=Quantum of Solace Hits DVD & Blu-ray in March|publisher=ComingSoon.net|date=13 January 2009|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=51899|accessdate=13 January 2009}} ==Reception== ===Box office=== Upon its opening in the UK, the film grossed £4.9 million ($8 million), breaking the record for the largest Friday opening (31 October 2008) in the UK.{{cite news|author=Archie Thomas|title='Solace' makes quantum leap in U.K.|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=1 November 2008|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995122.html |accessdate=1 November 2008}} The film then broke the UK opening-weekend record, taking £15.5 million ($25 million) in its first weekend, surpassing the previous record of £14.9 million held by ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]''. It earned a further £14 million in France and Sweden—where it opened on the same day. The weekend gross of the equivalent of $10.6 million in France was a record for the series, surpassing what ''Casino Royale'' made in five days by 16%. The $2.7 million gross in Sweden was the fourth-highest opening for a film there.{{cite news|title=Bond film smashes weekend records|publisher=[[BBC News Online]]|date=3 November 2008|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7705631.stm|accessdate=3 November 2008}}{{cite news|author=Dave McNary|title=James Bond finds overseas 'Solace'|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=2 November 2008|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995151.html |accessdate=3 November 2008}} The following week, the film was playing in sixty countries. It grossed the equivalent of $39.3 million in the UK, $16.5 million in France and $7.7 million in Germany on 7 November 2008.{{cite news|author=Pamela McClintock|title='Quantum' leap in overseas box office|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=8 November 2008|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995539.html |accessdate=9 November 2008}} The film broke records in Switzerland, Finland, United Arab Emirates, Nigeria, Romania and Slovenia. Its Chinese and Indian openings were the second-largest ever for foreign-language films.{{cite news|author=Dave McNary|title='Quantum' rules foreign box office|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=9 November 2008|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117995548.html |accessdate=10 November 2008}} The film grossed $27 million on its opening day in 3,451 cinemas in Canada and the United States, where it was the number one film for the weekend, with $67.5 million and $19,568 average per cinema.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?view=&yr=2008&wknd=46&p=.htm | title=Weekend Box Office Results from 11/14 – 11/16 | publisher=Box Office Mojo | accessdate=14 November 2008}} It was the highest-grossing opening weekend ''Bond'' film in the US,{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/franchises/chart/?id=jamesbond.htm | title=James Bond Movies | publisher=Box Office Mojo | accessdate=14 November 2008}} and tied with ''[[The Incredibles]]'' for the biggest November opening outside of the ''[[Harry Potter (film series)|Harry Potter]]'' series. The film earned a B- from [[CinemaScore]]'s audience surveys.{{cite news|author=Joshua Rich|title='Quantum of Solace' Stirs up a Win|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=16 November 2008|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20240780,00.html|accessdate=17 November 2008}} From the British opening on 31 October, through to the US opening weekend on 14 November, the film had grossed a total $319,128,882 worldwide. As of 10 February 2010, it had grossed the equivalent of $417,722,300 in countries other than Canada and the US, where it grossed $168,368,427, to give a total of $586,090,727. ===Critical response=== On [[review aggregator]] [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film has an [[approval rating]] of 65% based on 285 reviews, with an [[average rating]] of 6.2/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "Brutal and breathless, ''Quantum Of Solace'' delivers tender emotions along with frenetic action, but coming on the heels of ''Casino Royale'', it's still a bit of a disappointment."{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/quantum_of_solace/|title=Quantum of Solace (2008)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango (company)|Fandango]]|accessdate=11 July 2017}} On [[Metacritic]] the film has a weighted average score of 58 out of 100 based on 48 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/quantum-of-solace|title=Quantum of Solace Reviews|website=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=15 May 2018}} Critics generally preferred ''Casino Royale'', but continued to praise Daniel Craig's depiction of Bond, and agree that the film is still an enjoyable addition to the series. The action sequences and pacing were praised, but criticism grew over the realism and serious but gritty feel that the film carried over.{{cite news|author=Tom Butler |title=UK Tomatometer Preview: Quantum Of Solace – Is the New Bond Shaken or Stirred? |publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |date=31 October 2008 |url=http://uk.rottentomatoes.com/m/quantum_of_solace/news/1777726/uk_tomatometer_preview_quantum_of_solace_is_the_new_bond_shaken_or_stirred |accessdate=1 November 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081106152925/http://uk.rottentomatoes.com/m/quantum_of_solace/news/1777726/uk_tomatometer_preview_quantum_of_solace_is_the_new_bond_shaken_or_stirred |archivedate= 6 November 2008 |df= }} [[Roger Moore]], the third actor to play Bond in the films, said that Daniel Craig was a "damn good Bond but the film as a whole, there was a bit too much flash cutting [and] it was just like a commercial of the action. There didn't seem to be any geography and you were wondering what the hell was going on."{{cite news|title=Sir Roger Moore weighs in on 'Quantum of Solace'|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]]|date=16 March 2009|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/news/index.php?itemid=7432&t=mi6&s=news|accessdate=17 March 2009}} [[Kim Newman]] of ''[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]'' gave it 4/5, remarking it was not "bigger and better than ''Casino Royale'', [which is] perhaps a smart move in that there's still a sense at the finish that Bond's mission has barely begun." However, he expressed nostalgia for the more humorous Bond films.{{cite web|author=[[Kim Newman]]|url=http://www.empireonline.com/reviews/reviewcomplete.asp?FID=134523|title=''Quantum of Solace'' (12A)|work=[[Empire (magazine)|Empire]]|accessdate=22 October 2008}} ''[[The Sunday Times]]'' review noted that "following ''Casino Royale'' was never going to be easy, but the director Marc Forster has brought the brand's successful relaunch crashing back to earth—with a yawn"; the screenplay "is at times incomprehensible" and the casting "is a mess." The review concludes that "Bond has been stripped of his iconic status. He no longer represents anything particularly British, or even modern. In place of glamour, we get a spurious grit; instead of style, we get [[product placement]]; in place of fantasy, we get a redundant and silly realism."{{cite news|author=[[Cosmo Landesman]]|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/film/film_reviews/article5001623.ece|title=Quantum of Solace – The Sunday Times review|work=[[The Sunday Times]]|date=26 October 2008|accessdate=28 October 2008 | location=London}} ''[[The Guardian]]'' gave a more positive review, rating it as 4 stars, and was particularly fond of Daniel Craig's performance, saying he "made the part his own, every inch the coolly ruthless agent-killer, nursing a broken heart and coldly suppressed rage" and calling the film "a crash-bang Bond, high on action, low on quips, long on location glamour, short on product placement"; it concludes "''Quantum of Solace'' isn't as good as ''Casino Royale'': the smart elegance off Daniel Craig's Bond debut has been toned down in favour of conventional action. But the man himself powers this movie; he carries the film: it's an indefinably difficult task for an actor. Craig measures up."{{cite news|author=[[Peter Bradshaw]]|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2008/oct/18/jamesbond1|title=Quantum of Solace|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=18 October 2008|accessdate=28 October 2008 | location=London}} ''[[Screen International|Screen Daily]]'' says, "Notices will focus—rightly—on Craig's magnetism as the steely, sexy, murderous MI6 agent, but two other factors weigh in and freshen up proceedings: Forster's new technical team, led by cinematographer Roberto Schaefer and production designer Dennis Gassner. And the ongoing shift of M, as played by Judi Dench, to front and centre: the Bond girls fade into insignificance as she becomes his moral counterpoint and theirs is the only real relationship on screen." The review continues, "Bond is, as has been previously noted, practically the [[Martin Scorsese]] of the [[BAFTA]]s: 22 films later, with grosses probably close to the [[Gross domestic product|GDP]] of one of the small nations it depicts, it's still waiting for that [[BAFTA Award for Best British Film|Alexander Korda award]]. The best ''Casino Royale'' could achieve was a gong for sound. Will this be the year that changes its fortunes?"{{cite web|title=Quantum of Solace|publisher=Screen Daily|date=20 October 2008|url=http://www.screendaily.com/ScreenDailyArticle.aspx?intStoryID=41477|accessdate=1 November 2008}} [[Roger Ebert]] of the ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]'', who praised the previous film, disliked ''Quantum of Solace''. He wrote that the plot was mediocre, characters weak and that Bond lacked his usual personality, despite his praise for Daniel Craig's interpretation of the role. Throughout his review, he emphasised that "James Bond is not an action hero."[http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20081111/REVIEWS/811129989 Review] by Roger Ebert, ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]'', 12 November 2008 [[Kate Muir]] wrote in ''[[The Times]]'' that "The ''Bond'' franchise is 50 years old this year, and the scriptless mess of ''Quantum of Solace'' may be considered its mid-life crisis", before she went on to praise the film's successor ''[[Skyfall]]'' as a "resurrection".{{cite news|last=Muir|first=Kate|title=Bond's resurrection is one to die for|newspaper=[[The Times]]|date=13 October 2012|authorlink=Kate Muir|location=London|page=4}} Some writers criticised the choice of ''Quantum of Solace'' as a title. "Yes, it's a bad title," wrote Marni Weisz, the editor of ''Famous'', a Canadian film publication distributed in cinemas in that country, in an editorial entitled "At least it's not ''[[Octopussy (film)|Octopussy]]''."Marni Weisz, "At least it's not Octopussy," ''Famous'', October 2008, p. 6 Not all the reviews were as critical. Tim Robey of ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', in a reflective review of the film in 2013, was positive. He praised the film's shorter runtime, claiming that many other ''Bond'' films run out of steam before the end, and included ''Casino Royale'' in this category. Describing the film as having a "rock-solid dramatic idea and the intelligence to run with it", he gave the film four stars out of five.{{cite news|last=Robey|first=Tim|title=James Bond: Quantum of Solace, Review|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/filmreviews/10540055/James-Bond-Quantum-of-Solace-review.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=30 December 2013|location=London}} ===Accolades=== The film was nominated for Best Original Score, Best Original Song, Visual Effects, Film and Sound Editing at the 2008 [[Satellite Awards]], winning Best Song.{{cite web|url=http://www.pressacademy.com/satawards/awards2008.shtml|title=2008 13th Annual SATELLITE Awards|publisher=[[International Press Academy]]|accessdate=15 December 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081209100353/http://www.pressacademy.com/satawards/awards2008.shtml |archivedate=9 December 2008}} It was nominated for Best Action Movie at the 2009 [[Critics' Choice Movie Awards|Critics' Choice Awards]],{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117997072.html |author=Dade Hayes|title=Critics Choice favors 'Milk,' 'Button'|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=9 December 2008|accessdate=9 December 2008}} and at the [[Empire Awards]], which is voted for by the public, it was shortlisted for Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Newcomer, Best Thriller and Best Soundtrack.{{cite news|title=Empire Awards nominate 'Quantum of Solace' five times, vote now online|publisher=[[MI6-HQ.com]]|date=2 March 2009|url=http://www.mi6-hq.com/news/index.php?itemid=7396&t=mi6&s=news|accessdate=3 March 2009}} It was nominated for the [[Saturn Award]] for Best Action/Adventure/Thriller Film, while Kurylenko and Dench were both nominated for the Best Supporting Actress award.{{cite web|url=http://www.saturnawards.org/nominations.html |title=Nominations for the 35th Annual Saturn Awards |publisher=[[Saturn Award|Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films]] |accessdate=17 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65olbBrXC?url=http://www.saturnawards.org/nominations.html |archivedate=29 February 2012 |df=dmy }} It was nominated by the [[7th Visual Effects Society Awards|Visual Effects Society Awards]] for "Outstanding Compositing in a Feature Motion Picture."{{cite web|url=https://www.visualeffectssociety.com/ayear/7th-annual-ves-awards|title=7th Annual VES Awards|work=visual effects society|accessdate=December 21, 2017}} An editorial by ''[[The Times]]'' also listed the film's pre-titles sequence as the tenth-greatest car chase in film history.{{cite news|author=Michael Moran|title=The 20 greatest car chases in movie history|work=[[The Times]]|date=20 November 2008|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/film/article5199765.ece?token=null&offset=0&page=1|accessdate=3 December 2008 | location=London}} ==See also== revision.text:
{{Infobox video game |title = |image = RACE Pro.jpg |developer = [[SimBin Studios]] |publisher = [[Atari]] |designer = |engine = Lizard |released = February 17, 2009<ref>{{cite web|url=http://xbox360.ign.com/objects/142/14254925.html|title=IGN Race Pro|publisher=IGN|accessdate=2009-01-27}}</ref> |genre = [[Sim racing]] |modes = [[Single-player]], [[Multi-player]] |platforms = [[Xbox 360]] }}
'''''Race Pro''''' is a [[sim racing]] [[video game]] developed by SimBin Studios (later [[Sector3 Studios]]) and published by [[Atari]] exclusively for [[Xbox 360]].<ref>{{cite web| title=IGN RacePro| publisher=IGN| url=http://xbox360.ign.com/objects/142/14254925.html| date=| accessdate=2008-10-09}}</ref> The game is described as having "ultra realistic car models" with cars ranging in power from {{convert|200|hp|abbr=on}} to {{convert|1000|hp|abbr=on}}. The game uses the new Lizard game engine whereas the PC SimBin games used the Gmotor engine.<ref>{{cite web| title=RacePro Atari Gamer's Day2008 Interview Prt.1| publisher=Gamespot | url=http://www.gamespot.com/xbox360/driving/racepro/video/6197609/racepro-atari-gamers-day-2008-interview-1| date=| accessdate=2008-10-12}}</ref> This marks the first console game completed and released by SimBin.<ref>{{cite web| title=PC racing sim developer SimBin takes the console plunge| publisher=IGN| url=http://xbox360.ign.com/articles/888/888242p1.html| date=| accessdate=2008-10-09}}</ref>
The game uses the ISI (RFactor) game engine under license. It features cars and drivers from the 2007, 2006 and the original 1987 [[FIA]] [[World Touring Car Championship]] seasons, as well as the European F3000, Formula BMW, Mini Challenge and Caterham cup. The game also has three [[FIA GT Championship|GT]] categories, on top of this it has racing [[Radical Sportscars|Radicals]] and road cars which are the [[Audi R8 (road car)|Audi R8]], [[Koenigsegg CCX]], [[Koenigsegg CCXR]] and [[Dodge Viper]].
The drivers in the game are mostly real people, such as [[Tiff Needell]], [[Tor Graves]], and all the Touring car drivers of the [[2007 World Touring Car Championship season|2007 FIA WTCC championship]].
==Tracks== Tracks available in the game are those that were used in the 2007 WTCC and only the configuration used that year is available to drive for each circuit. They can all be raced in offline and online and in wet and dry conditions with up to sixteen entrants.
[[Autódromo Internacional de Curitiba]], [[Pau Grand Prix|Circuit de Pau]], Macau's [[Guia Circuit]] and [[Circuito da Boavista|Porto Circuit]] had not been playable before on seventh-generation consoles though you could drive around Macau and sections of the Guia Circuit in [[Project Gotham Racing 4]].
The other tracks are [[Circuit de Valencia]], [[Brno Circuit]], [[Brands Hatch]], [[Motorsport Arena Oschersleben]], [[Autodromo Nazionale Monza]], [[Scandinavian Raceway|Anderstorp Raceway]], [[Circuit Park Zandvoort]], [[Mazda Raceway Laguna Seca]], and [[Road America]].
==Reception==
''Race Pro'' has received mixed ratings, with an average [[Metacritic]] score of 72%. The main criticisms were the grainy textures and large amounts of [[Screen tearing|tearing]], sparsely constructed tracks, and lack of in-game music. The game has an issue whereby it can sometimes lose players' saved career progress when going online. Wet weather is cosmetic only, so grip levels do not change.<ref>{{cite web |title=RacePro Metacritic Score |publisher=Metacritic |url=http://www.metacritic.com/games/platforms/xbox360/racepro |date=| accessdate=2009-03-23}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://xbox360.ign.com/objects/142/14254925.html ''Race Pro''] at [[IGN]] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090527090453/http://www.itreviews.co.uk/games/g544.htm Race Pro Review at IT Reviews] *[http://racepro-esp.foroactivo.com/ ''Foro de la Comunidad Hispanoparlante del Race Pro en Xbox360''] {{SimBin games}}

{{Infobox company | name = Roc Nation, LLC. | logo = Roc Nation logo.png | type = [[Privately held company|Private]]
[[Limited liability company]] | industry = [[Show business|Entertainment]] | founded = {{Start date and age|2008}} | founder = [[Jay-Z]] | location_city = [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]] | location_country = [[United States]] | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = {{ubl|Jay Brown ([[Chief executive officer|CEO]])|Michael Yormark ([[President (corporate title)|President]])|Lenny Santiago ([[Senior vice-president|SVP]])}} | services = {{ubl|[[Management]]|[[Music publisher (popular music)|Music publishing]]}} | parent = [[Live Nation Entertainment]] | divisions = {{ubl|Arrive Venture Capital|Roc Nation Records|[[Roc Nation Sports]]|[[StarRoc]]}} | website = {{URL|http://rocnation.com}} }} '''Roc Nation, LLC''' is an American entertainment company founded by [[Jay-Z]] in 2008. The company has offices in [[New York City]], [[London]], [[Nashville]], [[Austin]], and [[Los Angeles]]. The full-service entertainment company houses a record label, talent agency, touring and concert production company, music, film, and television production company as well as a music publishing house. The company is home to a diverse roster of recording artists, musicians and record producers such as [[J. Cole]], [[Big Sean]], [[Claudia Leitte]], [[Vic Mensa]], [[Grimes (musician)|Grimes]], [[Demi Lovato]], [[Shakira]], [[DJ Khaled]], [[Omarion]], [[T.I.]], and [[The Lox]]. The company also has partnerships with global management companies Three Six Zero Group, Urban Media Global Network Collective, Philymack and RJ Nation Entertainment World Wide... ==History== In 2008, Roc Nation was founded by [[Jay-Z]]. The firm has a multi-year partnership with live event company [[Live Nation]].{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/04/03/arts/music/03jayz.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0 |title=In Rapper's Deal, a New Model for Music Business |publisher=New York Times |date=2008-04-03 |accessdate=2014-09-03}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/eeel45eddfj/2-shawn-jay-z-carter-475-million |title=Forbes – JAY |publisher=Forbes |date=2013-10-14 |accessdate=2014-09-03}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hitsdailydouble.com/news/newsPage.cgi?news09990m01 |title=NEAR TRUTHS BY I.B. BAD |publisher=Hits Daily Double |date=2014-08-01 |accessdate=2014-09-03}} In June 2009, Roc Nation signed a 4-year distribution deal with [[Sony Music Entertainment|Sony Music]].{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/268241/jay-z-confirms-roc-nation-deals-with-sony-atlantic|title=Jay-Z confirms Roc Nation deal with Sony |publisher=Universal Music |date=2013-04-08 |accessdate=2014-09-03}} In 2010, Roc Nation partnered with London-based entertainment company Three Six Zero Group.{{cite web|last=Week|first=Music|title=Three Six Zero signs Roc Nation deal|url=http://www.musicweek.com/news/read/three-six-zero-signs-roc-nation-deal/044666|work=Music Week|publisher=Music Week|accessdate=14 March 2013}} In February 2013, Roc Nation signed a worldwide music publishing administration deal with [[Warner/Chappell Music]].{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/global/1549317/jay-z-roc-nation-sign-global-publishing-administration-deals-with |title=Roc Nation signs publishing administration deal with Warner/Chappell |publisher=Billboard |date=2013-02-19|accessdate=2014-04-02}} In April 2013, Roc Nation formed a new sports management division, [[Roc Nation Sports]], a subsidiary dedicated to sports representation for professional athletes.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/04/03/sports/new-jay-z-lyrics-for-athletes-please-let-me-represent-you.html?hp&_r=0 |title=With New Move, Jay-Z Enters a Sports Agent State of Mind |publisher=The New York Times |date=2013-04-02|accessdate=2013-04-02}} Shortly thereafter, Roc Nation Sports also launched a boxing promotion division.{{cite news|url=http://sportsagentblog.com/2015/02/12/roc-nation-sports-signs-6-new-boxers/ |title=Roc Nation Sports Signs 6 New Boxers |publisher=Sports Agent Blog |date=2015-02-12|accessdate=2015-04-17}} After the Sony deal expired, in April 2013, Roc Nation signed a multi-year partnership with [[Universal Music Group|Universal Music]].{{cite web|url=http://www.universalmusic.com/corporate/detail/2471 |title=Universal Music Group strikes global partnership with Roc Nation |publisher=Universal Music |date=2013-04-08 |accessdate=2014-09-03}} In February 2015, Roc Nation and Three Six Zero Group announced the formation of Three Six Zero Entertainment, a division representing clients in film, television and the literary arts.{{cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/6472674/jay-z-roc-nation-three-six-zero-entertainment-film-and-television |title=Jay Z's Roc Nation and Three Six Zero Partner to Launch Film and Television Management Arm |publisher=Billboard |date=2015-02-12|accessdate=2015-04-17}} In November 2016, the administrator of [[Prince (musician)|Prince]]'s estate authorized a copyright lawsuit against Roc Nation for putting 15 of Prince's albums up on their affiliated streaming service [[Tidal (service)|Tidal]].{{cite web | url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr-esq/jay-zs-roc-nation-sued-streaming-prince-albums-tidal-947794 | title = Jay Z's Roc Nation Sued for Streaming Prince Albums on Tidal | date=16 November 2016 | accessdate = 17 November 2016 | publisher = ''The Hollywood Reporter'' | author = Eriq Gardner}} In beginning of March 2017, Roc Nation announced the formation of Arrive, a new division of the company that will focus on investing and nurturing promising startups.https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/jay-z-announces-new-startup-company-arrive-w470586 In July 2017, Roc Nation collaborated with art collective MSFTSrep. ==Artists== {{Infobox record label | name = Roc Nation Records | image = Roc Nation logo.png | image_size = 200px | parent = Roc Nation | founded = {{Start date and age|2008}} | founder = [[Jay-Z|Shawn "JAY-Z" Carter]] | distributor = [[Universal Music Group]] | genre = Various | country = [[United States]] | location = [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]] | revision.text:
{{coord|59|20|5|N|18|6|5|E|region:SE_type:landmark|display=title}} {{Infobox network |network_name = Sveriges Radio (SR) |network_logo = [[Image:Sveriges Radio.svg|250px|SR logo]] |country = [[Sweden]] |network_type = [[Public broadcasting]] |available = National |owner = |key_people = |launch_date = {{Start date and age|1925|01|01|df=yes}} (radio)
{{Start date and age|1956|09|04|df=yes}} (television) |past_names = Radiotjänst (1925-1957) |website = [http://www.sverigesradio.se/ www.sverigesradio.se] }} [[Image:Sveriges Radio 2008c.jpg|thumb|280px|The Sveriges Radio building in Stockholm]] '''Sveriges Radio [[Aktiebolag|AB]]''' ({{IPA-sv|ˈsværjɛs ˈrɑːdɪʊ}}, "Swedish Radio") is [[Sweden]]'s national publicly funded [[radio programming|radio]] broadcaster. Sveriges Radio is a [[public limited company]], owned by an independent foundation, and funded through a [[television licence|licensing fee]], the level of which is decided by the [[Riksdag|Swedish Riksdag]]. No advertising is permitted. Its legal status could be described as that of a [[quasi-autonomous non-governmental organisation|quasi-autonomous non-governmental organization]]. ==History== The company – which was founded as '''AB Radiotjänst''' ("Radio Service Ltd") by a consortium of newspaper companies, the [[Tidningarnas Telegrambyrå|TT news agency]], and radio manufacturing interests on 21 March 1924 – made its first broadcast on 1 January 1925: a relay of High Mass from [[Saint James's Church, Stockholm|St James's Church]] in [[Stockholm]]. It was officially renamed Sveriges Radio in 1957. Sveriges Radio was originally responsible for all broadcasting in Sweden, both radio and television, and hosted the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1975|1975 Eurovision Song Contest]]. A reorganization in 1979 saw it become the parent company of four subsidiaries: *Sveriges Riksradio (RR), ''Swedish National Radio''; *Sveriges Lokalradio (LRAB), ''Swedish Local Radio''; *[[Sveriges Utbildningsradio]] (UR), ''Swedish Educational Broadcasting''; and *[[Sveriges Television]] (SVT), ''Swedish Television''. This structure was dissolved in 1993 with the national and local radio companies merging under the name of the old parent company: Sveriges Radio AB. == National radio == Four radio channels are available nationwide on [[FM radio|FM]] and via the [[internet]]."[http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=3756&artikel=3649665 Direktlänkar, kanaler i MP3 (192 kbps)] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120716115450/http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=3756&artikel=3649665 |date=2012-07-16 }}", links to channels streaming in mp3 format. Sveriges Radio's webpage. Retrieved 9 May 2010. *[[Sveriges Radio P1|P1]]: news, culture, debate, readings, documentaries, etc. Almost no music is played, except in the daily summertime programme ''[[Sommar (radio program)|Sommar]]'', in which guest presenters introduce their own choice of music. *[[Sveriges Radio P2|P2]]: classical music, folk, jazz and world music; the channel also carries some minority-language programming. *[[Sveriges Radio P3|P3]]: popular music and comedy targeted at a younger audience. *[[Sveriges Radio P4|P4]]: popular music, entertainment and sport, chiefly targeted at an older audience; the network is made up of 25 local stations, each of which carries a mix of local and national programming. == Local radio == A large part of P4's programming is regional with 25 regions each broadcasting their own local programmes during most of the day. *[[P4 Blekinge]], for [[Blekinge County]] *[[P4 Dalarna]] *[[P4 Gotland]] *[[P4 Gävleborg]] *[[P4 Göteborg]] *[[P4 Halland]], for [[Halland County]] *[[P4 Jämtland]] *[[P4 Jönköping]] *[[P4 Kalmar]], for [[Kalmar County]] *[[P4 Kristianstad]], for the former [[Kristianstad County]], now north and eastern [[Skåne County]] *[[P4 Kronoberg]] *[[P4 Malmöhus]], for the former [[Malmöhus County]], now south-western [[Skåne County]] *[[P4 Norrbotten]] *[[P4 Sjuhärad]], for [[Sjuhärad]], the south-eastern part of [[Västra Götaland County]] *[[P4 Skaraborg]], for the former [[Skaraborg County]], now north-eastern [[Västra Götaland County]] *[[P4 Stockholm]] *[[P4 Sörmland]] *[[P4 Uppland]] *[[P4 Värmland]] *[[P4 Väst]], for western [[Västergötland]], [[Dalsland]] and northern [[Bohuslän]], north-western [[Västra Götaland County]] *[[P4 Västerbotten]] *[[P4 Västernorrland]] *[[P4 Västmanland]], for [[Västmanland]] *[[P4 Örebro]], for [[Örebro County]] *[[P4 Östergötland]], for [[Östergötland County]] Additional radio stations available locally on FM include: *[[Din gata 100,6]] (in Malmö): playing mostly hiphop and [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] *[[Metropol 93,8]] (in Stockholm): multicultural youth station for Stockholm (formerly SR P5 Radio Stockholm) *[[SR P2 Musik]] (in Stockholm): relays most of the output of [[P2 (radio station)|P2]], but replaces programming in minority and foreign languages (available in Stockholm from P6, see below) with additional music output – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/tabla.aspx?programid=2562 Schedule] *[[SR P6 89,6]] (in Stockholm): broadcasts in minority and foreign languages as well as relaying programmes from the web-based [[P2 Världen]] channel and (overnight) the [[BBC World Service]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/tabla.aspx?programid=166 Schedule] == Other channels == Sveriges Radio also provides a number of channels through [[Digital audio broadcasting]], using the [[Digital Audio Broadcasting|DAB]] standard, and via the internet. *[[SR International - Radio Sweden]] (web, satellite) *[[SR P7 Sisuradio]], in [[Finnish language|Finnish]] and [[Meänkieli]] (DAB, web and cable) *[[Radioapans knattekanal]], children's radio (web) *[[SR c]], experimental arts radio (web) *[[SR P2 Världen]], world music radio (DAB and web) *[[SR Klassiskt]], classical music (DAB and web) *[[SR Minnen]], programmes from the SR archive (DAB and web) *[[SR P3 Star]], hit music for teenagers (DAB and web) *[[SR Sápmi]], for the [[Sami languages]] (web) *[[Alltid nyheter]], news (web) == SR International == {{main|SR International – Radio Sweden}} SR International is the international channel of Sveriges Radio and offers programming in the following languages: *[[Modern Standard Arabic|Arabic]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2494 website] *[[English language|English]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2054 website] *[[German language|German]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2108 website] *[[Kurdish language|Kurdish]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2200 website] *[[Persian language|Persian]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2493 website] *[[Romani language|Romani]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2122 website] *[[Russian language|Russian]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2103 website] *[[Somali language|Somali]] – [http://sverigesradio.se/sida/default.aspx?programid=2172 website] SR International is not responsible for programming in the domestic minority languages, [[Finnish language|Finnish]] and [[Sámi language|Sámi]], which have their own dedicated channels. See ''Other channels'' above. On 16 March 2010, Radio Sweden announced the end of broadcasts on shortwave and medium wave as from 31 October 2010.[http://www.sr.se/cgi-bin/International/nyhetssidor/artikel.asp?ProgramID=2054&Format=1&artikel=3562645 Radio Sweden Ends Medium, Short Wave, Sveriges Radio International, 16 March 2010.] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090723083641/http://www.sr.se/cgi-bin/International/nyhetssidor/artikel.asp?ProgramID=2054&Format=1&artikel=3562645 |date=July 23, 2009 }} External service programmes would continue on the internet only.[https://web.archive.org/web/20100323074209/http://blogs.rnw.nl/medianetwork/radio-sweden-to-become-an-internet-only-station Radio Sweden to become an Internet-only station, Media Network, 17 March 2010.] Language services for immigrants to Sweden in Albanian, Syriac, Serbian, Bosnian, and Croat would also be discontinued, while programmes in English (also on the domestic service), German, Russian, Persian, Dari, and Kurdish would remain.[http://www.sr.se/cgi-bin/International/nyhetssidor/artikel.asp?ProgramID=2054&Format=1&artikel=3562645 Radio Sweden Ends Medium, Short Wave, Sveriges Radio International, 16. March 2010.] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090723083641/http://www.sr.se/cgi-bin/International/nyhetssidor/artikel.asp?ProgramID=2054&Format=1&artikel=3562645 |date=July 23, 2009 }} == See also == *[[List of Swedish radio stations]] *[[Åke Blomström Award]] *[[Modern Times Group]] (commercial broadcaster) *[[NORMOB]] *[[Radiotjänst i Kiruna]] (licence fee agency) *[[Sveriges Utbildningsradio]] *[[Swedish Broadcasting Commission]] *[[Teracom]] (transmitters) == References == == External links == {{Commonscat}} *[http://www.radiosweden.org Radio Sweden] - Official site {{en icon}} *[http://www.sr.se Sveriges Radio] - Official site {{sv}} *[http://www.sr.se/international/ SR International] - Official site (multilingual) *[http://www.sr.se/Podradio/xml/SRI_en_sweToday.xml Archive of daily podcasts (mp3)] {{en icon}} {{European Broadcasting Union Members}} [[Category:Media companies of Sweden]] [[Category:Radio in Sweden]] [[Category:Publicly funded broadcasters]] [[Category:European Broadcasting Union members]] [[Category:Multilingual broadcasters|Sweden]] [[Category:Media companies established in 1925]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1925]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 1956]] [[Category:Swedish companies established in 1925]] [[Category:State media]] [[Category:Sveriges Radio|Sveriges Radio]]

revision.text:
{{About|the film|persons nicknamed "Hebrew Hammer"|Hebrew Hammer (disambiguation){{!}}Hebrew Hammer}} {{refimprove|date=March 2014}} {{Infobox film | name = The Hebrew Hammer | image = Hebrew Hammer DVD cover.jpg | image_size = 215px | alt = | caption = DVD cover | director = Jonathan Kesselman | producer = Lisa Fragner
Josh Kesselman
[[Sofia Sondervan]]
[[Edward R. Pressman]] | writer = Jonathan Kesselman | starring = [[Adam Goldberg]]
[[Judy Greer]]
[[Andy Dick]]
[[Mario Van Peebles]]
[[Peter Coyote]] | music = Michael Cohen | cinematography = Kurt Brabbee | editing = Dean Holland | studio = ContentFilm
Intrinsic Value Films | distributor = [[Comedy Central|Comedy Central Films]] {{small|(TV)}}
[[Strand Releasing]] {{small|(Theatrical)}} | released = {{Film date|2003|01|23|[[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance]]|2003|12|08|TV|2003|12|19|Theatrical}} | runtime = 85 minutes | country = United States | language = English
Hebrew
Yiddish | budget = $1.3 million | gross = $82,157{{mojo title|hebrewhammer|The Hebrew Hammer}} }} '''''The Hebrew Hammer''''' is a 2003 American [[comedy film]] written and directed by Jonathan Kesselman. It stars [[Adam Goldberg]], [[Judy Greer]], [[Andy Dick]], [[Mario Van Peebles]], and [[Peter Coyote]]. The plot concerns a [[Jewish]] [[blaxploitation]] crime fighter known as the Hebrew Hammer who must save [[Hanukkah]] from the evil son of [[Santa Claus]], who wants to destroy Hanukkah and [[Kwanzaa]] and make everyone celebrate [[Christmas]]. The film parodies blaxploitation films, and features [[Melvin Van Peebles]] in a cameo as "[[Sweet Sweetback's Baadasssss Song|Sweetback]]". ==Plot== The film begins with a flashback to a young Mordechai Jefferson Carver. At school, Mordechai is tormented by his fellow students and his teacher for being a Jewish child in a public school predominantly attended by Christians, and for celebrating Hanukkah while everyone else celebrates Christmas. He feels further alienated as he walks through his neighborhood and sees a seemingly endless number of Christmas decorations and window displays celebrating the holiday and announcing that Jews aren't welcome. As he lies down on the sidewalk in front of a store saying "Jews Welcome (for about 5 minutes)" and spins his [[dreidel]] to cheer himself up, Santa Claus walks by and crushes the toy under his foot, then gives Mordechai the [[middle finger|finger]]. The scene then changes to the present with Mordechai as the Hebrew Hammer, a certified [[Male circumcision|circumcised]] [[Detective|dick]] who has dedicated his life to defending Jews. His snappy dress (a cross between that of a pimp and a [[Hasidic Jew]]) and tough-guy demeanor have made him a local hero within the Jewish community. Jews and African-Americans have enjoyed a tenuous peace with the White Christians over the previous few decades, because the current Santa (the son of the cruel Santa who stomped Mordechai's dreidel years earlier) has pursued a policy of inclusion and tolerance. This Santa is murdered and replaced by his son, Damian, who seeks to destroy Hanukkah and Kwanzaa thus reserving December for Christmas alone. Mordechai is reluctantly recruited to stop Damian, gaining allies along the way, including love interest and daughter of the Chief of the Jewish Justice League Esther Bloomenbergensteinenthal and the Kwanzaa Liberation Front's leader Mohammed Ali Paula Abdul Rahim. The fight takes them to exotic locales such as [[Israel]], [[K-Mart]], the Jewish Atomic Clock outside [[Jerusalem]] and the final battle at the [[North Pole]]. ==Cast== * [[Adam Goldberg]] as Mordechai Jefferson Carver / The Hebrew Hammer ** [[Grant Rosenmeyer]] as young Mordechai * [[Judy Greer]] as Esther Bloomenbergensteinenthal * [[Andy Dick]] as Damian Claus * [[Mario Van Peebles]] as [[Muhammad Ali|Mohammed Ali]] [[Paula Abdul]] Rahim * [[Peter Coyote]] as Jewish Justice League Chief Bloomenbergensteinenthal * [[Nora Dunn]] as Mrs. Carver * Sean Whalen as [[Tiny Tim (A Christmas Carol)|Tiny Tim]] * [[Tony Cox (actor)|Tony Cox]] as Jamal * [[Richard Riehle]] as [[Santa Claus|Santa]] * [[Melvin Van Peebles]] ([[Cameo appearance|cameo]]) as [[Sweet Sweetback's Baadasssss Song|Sweetback]] * [[Rachel Dratch]] as Tikva * [[Harrison Chad]] as Schlomo * Annie McEnroe as Mrs. Highsmith * [[Elaine Hendrix]] as Blonde bombshell * [[Ed Koch]] as himself * [[Jimmy Walsh (actor)|Jimmy Walsh]] as Freckle-Faced Gentile * [[Jason Fuchs]] as Adolescent Hasidic Boy ==Controversy== ''The Hebrew Hammer'' parodies many common [[stereotype]]s about Jews. During filming, the movie came to the attention of the [[Anti-Defamation League]], which were concerned that it might promote unfavorable images of Jews; the film happens to include a direct parody of the ADL as members of the fictional Jewish Justice League. After viewing the film, Warren Katz of the ADL brought legal action against the producers of the film, but lost in a summary ruling handed down by the [[United States District Court for the Northern District of New York]]. The film also drew criticism from some Christian groups, who argued that the film portrayed most Christians as being anti-Semitic and intolerant. Many scenes were shot in [[Borough Park, Brooklyn|Borough Park]], [[Brooklyn]], which has a large community of Hasidic Jews. Filmmakers were initially concerned that members of the Hasidic community might protest the movie, as they did with the 1998 film ''[[A Price Above Rubies]]'', and shut down filming. Reaction of the Hasidim in Borough Park was mixed, however. No organized protest was pursued, and some residents of the neighborhood actually agreed to appear as extras in the film. ==Reception== The film received a rating of 52% on aggregate review site [[Rotten Tomatoes]].{{rotten-tomatoes|hebrew_hammer|The Hebrew Hammer}} ==Sequel== In 2017, plans for a sequel titled ''The Hebrew Hammer Vs. Hitler''{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2568284/|title=The Hebrew Hammer vs. Hitler}} were announced.{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/TheHebrewHammerII|title=The Hebrew Hammer II|access-date=22 November 2017}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.haaretz.com/life/film/1.824074|title=The Hebrew Hammer Is Set to Fight His Biggest Foes Yet - Hitler and anti-Semitism|last=|date=|website=Haaretz|publisher=|access-date=22 November 2017}} The sequel will be funded in part by crowd funding.{{Cite web|url=https://app.microventures.com/crowdfunding/hebrew-hammer-2|title=MicroVentures - The Hebrew Hammer Vs. Hitler|access-date=22 November 2017}} It will begin in the present day, with the Hammer coming out of retirement to fight the increase in racism brought on by Donald Trump's election. He does this by going back in time to fight the worst source of antisemitism in the 20th century. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050101090031/http://www.thehebrewhammer.com/ |date=January 1, 2005 |title=Archive of the official web site for the movie }} * {{IMDb title|0317640|The Hebrew Hammer}} * {{allrovi movie|273167|The Hebrew Hammer}} * {{mojo title|hebrewhammer|The Hebrew Hammer}} * {{rotten-tomatoes|hebrew_hammer|The Hebrew Hammer}} * {{metacritic film|the-hebrew-hammer|The Hebrew Hammer}} {{Comedy Central Films}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hebrew Hammer, The}} [[Category:2003 films]] [[Category:2000s comedy films]] [[Category:American Christmas films]] [[Category:American comedy films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:Comedy Central films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films about Jews and Judaism]] [[Category:Films about race and ethnicity]] [[Category:Films set in Israel]] [[Category:Films set in New York City]] [[Category:Films shot in New York City]] [[Category:Hanukkah films]] [[Category:Jewish comedy and humor]] [[Category:Kwanzaa]] [[Category:Santa Claus in television]] [[Category:Religious comedy films]]

{{Infobox film |name = The Magician's Hat |director = [[Milan Blažeković]] |producer = Vlado Terešak |writer = Fred Sharkey
[[Ivo Škrabalo]]
[[Sunčana Škrinjarić]] |starring = [[Dragan Milivojević]]
[[Emil Glad]]
Ivo Rogulja |studio = [[Croatia Film]] |distributor = '''United Kingdom''':
Castle Vision |released = {{Film date|1990}} |country = Yugoslavia |language = Croatian }} '''''The Magician's Hat''''' (Čarobnjakov šešir) is a [[1990 in film|1990 animated film]] produced by the [[Croatia Film]] [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UkD9AnoQecE CAROBNJAKOV SESIR-Trailer on YouTube] company and directed by [[Milan Blažeković]]. It is the sequel to 1986's ''[[The Elm-Chanted Forest]]''. ==Story== Thistle the magician teams up with his animal friends, along with some fairies and a volcano-dwelling dragon, to rescue their forest from the wrath of Mrazomor the Ice Emperor and his army of icy ghost witches. [https://www.filmaffinity.com/en/film691828.html FilmAffinity] [https://mubi.com/films/the-magician-s-hat MUBI] ==Release== In late 2007, both this film and its predecessor, ''The Elm-Chanted Forest'', received their DVD debut in the countries of former Yugoslavia from Happy TV. As of 2015, ''The Magician's Hat'' has seen no official release in North America. ==Cancelled US release== [[Peter Fernandez]] was working on an English dub for this film, but it was ultimately cancelled by American Distributors for reasons unknown, yet possibly due to the scene where Mrazomor gets stabbed in the chest by the Sword of Salvation and thought it was too dark for Western viewers, namely children. ==See also== * [[Cinema of Yugoslavia]] * [[Cinema of Croatia]] * [[List of animated feature-length films]] ==References== ==External links== * {{IMDb title|id=0333215|title=The Magician's Hat}} * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R1ShDjgPkZ0| Entire film without subtitles] on [[YouTube]] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dm2dSpBjtII| Translations of the main villain's scenes with subtitles] also on [[YouTube]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Magician's Hat}} [[Category:1990 films]] [[Category:Animated films about penguins]] [[Category:1990 animated films]] [[Category:Yugoslav films]] [[Category:Croatian films]] [[Category:Croatian animated films]] [[Category:Children's fantasy films]] [[Category:Films featuring anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Sequel films]] [[Category:Croatian children's films]] [[Category:Films about penguins]] {{animated-film-stub}} {{croatia-film-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox video game | title = THOTH | collapsible = | state = | image = | caption = | developer = Jeppe Carlsen | publisher = [[Double Fine Productions]] | series = | engine = [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[macOS]] | released = '''Windows, macOS'''
{{Video game release|WW|October 7, 2016}} | genre = [[Shoot 'em up#Multi-directional shooter|Multi-directional shooter]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]], [[multiplayer]] }} '''Thoth''' (stylised as '''THOTH''') is an abstract [[shoot 'em up]] video game created by Jeppe Carlsen, former lead gameplay designer of [[Playdead]] games ''[[Limbo (video game)|Limbo]]'' and ''[[Inside (video game)|Inside]]''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/thoth-a-trippy-deconstruction-of-arcade-shooters-w443624|title=New Game 'Thoth' Is a Trippy Deconstruction of Arcade Shooters|last=Walden|first=Matthew|date=5 October 2016|work=|newspaper=[[Rolling Stone]]|access-date=2016-10-16|via=}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.eurogamer.es/articles/2016-09-05-double-fine-anuncia-thoth|title=Double Fine anuncia Thoth|last=Maria Sempere|first=Josep|date=5 September 2016|work=|newspaper=Eurogamer.es|language=es|access-date=2016-10-16|via=}} It is published by [[Double Fine Productions]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/09/double-fine-presents-thoth-new-game-from-inside-pu.html|title=Double Fine Presents Thoth, New Game from Inside Puzzle Designer Jeppe Carlsen|last=Wade|first=Cameron|date=2 September 2016|work=|newspaper=[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]]|access-date=2016-10-16|via=}} == Development == As a solo developer, Carlsen had previously worked on independent platformer [[140 (video game)|''140'']]. Carlsen had thought about designing a game inspired by ''[[Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved]]'' and ''[[Robotron: 2084]]'' before he started working on ''Limbo''.{{Cite web|url=http://indiegames.com/2016/10/thoth.html|title=IndieGames.com THOTH Is A Horror Game, Disguised As Twin-Stick Shooter|last=Faust|first=Thomas|date=10 October 2016|website=indiegames.com|publisher=|access-date=2016-10-16}} Music for the game was composed by [[Experimental music|experimental]] composers SØS Gunver Ryberg and [[Cristian Vogel]]. == Gameplay == Progress through the levels of the game is made by eliminating all enemies. Doing so transforms them into ghostly voids that relentlessly chase the player. The game can be played solo or with two players cooperatively; when playing with a second player, the first player to die will become a ghost void that haunts the player. The main sequence of levels are divided into sets of four, each introducing new enemy types and [[game mechanics]]. If the main 64 levels are completed, the player gains access to randomly generated levels. == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:2016 video games]] [[Category:Double Fine Productions]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Unity (game engine) games]] [[Category:Shoot 'em ups]] [[Category:Video games developed in Denmark]] [[Category:MacOS games]]

{{advert|date=January 2012}} {{Infobox amusement park | name = Tropical Village | image = Entrancetropicalvillage.jpg | caption = | resort = | location = [[Ayer Hitam]], [[Batu Pahat District|Batu Pahat]], [[Johor]], [[Malaysia]] | location2 = | location3 = | coordinates = <!-- {{Coord|LAT|LON|type:landmark||display=inline,title}} --> | theme = [[Tourist attraction|World landmarks]] | homepage = | owner = | general_manager = | operator = | opening_date = <!-- {{Start date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | closing_date = <!-- {{End date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | previous_names = | season = | visitors = | area = | rides = | coasters = | water_rides = | slogan = | status = <!-- planned, under construction, operating, closed --> | footnotes = }}
[[Image:Tropicalvillagepetronastower.jpg|thumb|right|Tallest model in the park [[Petronas Towers]], [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]]]]
'''Tropical Village''' is a theme park in [[Ayer Hitam]], [[Batu Pahat District]], [[Johor]], [[Malaysia]].<ref>http://www.kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2008&dt=0720&pub=Kosmo&sec=Jom_Singgah&pg=jo_01.htm</ref>
The replicas of the structures are built within this 32 acres theme park that allow visitors to have another memorable experience. The park is divided into four sections: Landmarks, Leisure Corner, Playground and Agricultural Enclosure.
The Landmarks Section is a garden with a wonderful famous landmark in the whole world. There's a section of Malay Culture like [[Kompang]] sculpture, [[Kuda Kepang]], Mini Malaysia such as [[Petronas Towers]], [[Fort A famosa]] and Mini World.
The Leisure Corner is especially appealing to younger visitors with its Haunted House, House of Mirrors and Dinosaur Train among other attractions. The Playground with its Oriental Island, Pet Corner and Garden of the Shy Monkey is also a favourite with little ones. The park has dorms for visitors who want to stay overnight and continue the fun the next day.
== List of major attractions in the Mini World, Tropical Village == [[File:Paristropicalvillage.jpg|thumb|Eiffel Tower of Paris [[Eiffel Tower]]]] [[File:Statuetropicalvillage.jpg|thumb|Miniature [[Statue Of Liberty]]]]
===''Europe & USA'' region===
*[[Leaning Tower of Pisa]] - Italy *[[Statue of Liberty]] - USA *[[Colosseum]] - Italy *[[Eiffel Tower]] - France *[[Hollywood]] sign - USA *[[Windmills]] - Netherlands *[[The Little Mermaid (statue)]] - Denmark *[[Atomium]] - Belgium
===''Asia'' region=== [[File:TAJMAHALTROPVIL.jpg|thumbnail|right|Taj Mahal]]
*[[Great Wall of China]] - China *[[Sigiriya]] Lion Rock - Sri Lanka *[[Wat Pho]] Reclining Buddha - Thailand *[[Borobudur]] - Indonesia *[[Merlion]] - Singapore *[[Taj Mahal]] - India *[[Kuwait Towers]] - Kuwait *[[Giza ]] & [[Spinx]] - Egypt
===''Others'' famous replica=== *[[Moai]] sculpture - Easter Island *[[Japan]] kokeshi - Japan *[[Olmec colossal heads|Olmec head]] - Mexico *[[Budai]] - Chinese God *[[Bruce Lee]] Sculpture - Hong Kong *Jeju Island Sculpture - South Korea
==Transportation== The theme park is accessible by bus from [[Larkin Sentral]] (2, 888) in [[Johor Bahru]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://businterchange.net/johorbus/routes.html|title=Bus Routes in Johor Bahru|website=BusInterchange.net|accessdate=24 November 2017}}</ref>
==See also== {{commons category|Tropical Village}} * [[List of tourist attractions in Malaysia]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== {{facebook|TropicalVillageAyerHitamJohor}}
